required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of the Effects of Erythromycin on the Pharmacokinetics of Relugolix, Estradiol, and Norethindrone in Healthy Postmenopausal Women and on the Pharmacokinetics of Relugolix in Healthy Adult Men
clinical_study.official_title: A Two-Part, Open-Label, Fixed-Sequence, Two-Period Crossover Study to Assess the Effects of Erythromycin on the Pharmacokinetics of Relugolix, Estradiol, and Norethindrone After Administration of the Relugolix/Estradiol/Norethindrone Acetate Fixed-Dose Combination Tablet in Healthy Postmenopausal Women and on the Pharmacokinetics of Relugolix After Administration of a Single 120-mg Dose in Healthy Adult Men

brief_summary.textblock: This is a two-part, open-label, fixed-sequence, two-period crossover drug interaction study to assess the potential effects of erythromycin on the pharmacokinetics of relugolix, estradiol (E2), and norethindrone (NET) in healthy postmenopausal women (Part 1) and the pharmacokinetics of relugolix in healthy adult men (Part 2).

detailed_description.textblock: Each study part consists of two sequential treatment periods (Treatment Period 1 and Treatment Period 2) in which study participants will receive study treatments in a fixed (single)-sequence, crossover manner. In Part 1 of the study, a single relugolix/E2/norethindrone acetate (NETA) (40 milligrams [mg]/1 mg/0.5 mg) fixed-dose combination (FDC) tablet will be administered alone on Day 1 of Treatment Period 1; in Treatment Period 2, erythromycin will be administered on Day 1 to Day 12 (500 mg, four times daily [QID]) with co-administration of a single FDC tablet with the morning dose of erythromycin on Day 8. In Part 2 of the study, a single 120-mg dose of relugolix will be administered alone on Day 1 of Treatment Period 1; in Treatment Period 2, erythromycin will be administered on Day 1 to Day 12 (500 mg QID) with co-administration of a single 120-mg dose of relugolix with the morning dose of erythromycin on Day 8. There will be a nine-day washout interval between administration of study drug (the FDC tablet [Part 1] or relugolix 120 mg [Part 2]) on Day 1 of Treatment Period 1 and Treatment Period 2.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: In each study part (Part 1 and Part 2), study treatments will be administered in a fixed (single) sequence, crossover manner in two sequential treatment periods (Treatment Period 1 and Treatment Period 2).

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under The Concentration-time Curve From Time 0 Extrapolated To Infinity (AUC0-inf) Of Relugolix Or Other Analytes
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 8 predose and up to 120 hours postdose at multiple time points during Treatment Period 2 (Study Days 10 to 22)

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) Of Relugolix Or Other Analytes
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 8 predose and up to 120 hours postdose at multiple time points during Treatment Period 2 (Study Days 10 to 22)

secondary_outcome.measure: Predose Trough Plasma Concentrations (Ctrough) Of Erythromycin
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose on Day 7 and 8 of Treatment Period 2 (Study Days 10 to 22)

arm_group.description: Treatment Period 1: Healthy premenopausal women will receive a relugolix/E2/NETA (40 mg/1 mg/0.5 mg) alone on Day 1. Treatment Period 2: Healthy premenopausal women will receive erythromycin on Day 1 through 12 (500 mg, QID), with co-administration of a single dose of relugolix/E2/NETA (40 mg/1 mg/0.5 mg) with the morning dose of erythromycin on Day 8.

Treatment Period 1: Male participants will receive a single 120-mg dose of relugolix alone on Day 1. Treatment Period 2: Male participants will receive erythromycin on Days 1 through 12 (500 mg, QID), with co-administration of a single 120-mg dose of relugolix with the morning dose of erythromycin on Day 8.

intervention.description: Relugolix/E2/NETA (40 mg/1 mg/0.5 mg) FDC tablet; oral administration.

facility.name: Clinical Pharmacology of Miami, An Evolution Research Group Portfolio Company
